page.title: 15Travel and Transport .
page.content: Although the passenger railway closed in 1966,a train still runs about twice a week carrying spent nuclear fuel from Sizewell Power Station.Most people in Leiston travel by car if they want to leave the town.Some travel by bus to Saxmundham to catch a train to Ipswich or Lowestoft.Apart from this there is a county bus which leaves Aldeburgh, via Leiston,for Ipswich about every hour. It takes two hours to get to Ipswich by bus,half an hour by car! Some people travel by a coach which runs from Great Yarmouth, stopping at Leiston on its journey to London.This takes four hours from our town.Coaches are also used to bring children from surrounding villages to school.Others take people to many parts of Britain on holiday.Fire engines are also based in the town.
